Name: Bushido: Kami of Reflection
Description:
The Kami of Reflection is a beautiful if alien spirit. The icy tendrils that form its mortal realisation are hard as diamond but brittle as glass. As it moves the light from Amaratsu flows through its body, deflecting the energy of friend or enemy to prevent rituals and prayers alike.
—description from the publisher

Name: Bushido: The Grey Pilgrim
Description:
She's the daughter of Raijin, the god of thunder. 
—description from the publisher

Name: Bushido: Minor Kami of Water & Air
Description:
The Kami can no longer sit by and watch the Balance be thrown further from its natural alignment. Whilst the Temple benefit greatly from the advantages these Kami grant their forces, the stirring of the elements is a further sign of how much work is to be done.
—description from the publisher

Name: Trivial Pursuit: Pocket Edition
Description:
Trivial Pursuit Pocket Edition lets you play a great new way - anywhere without board! With the new Pocket Player.

Spinners/Scorers just spin to select a question category and slide to keep track of your score. The first player or team to score correct answers in all six categories wins.

Includes:

     2 Pocket Player Spinner/Scorers
     240 cards with 1440 all new questions and answers


—description from the back of the box

Name: Bushido: Xi
Description:
Xi’s driving motivation is to ensure her sister’s safety. Whilst she shares her sisters desire to bring the brothers to justice and see them pay for their crimes she does not prioritise it over the wellbeing of Yangjing or Yizhi. Her heritage always made her feel like an outsider in the courts of the Empire and she has found great self worth being the sword arm of her sisters, frustrating their would be attackers with perfectly orchestrated defence.
—description from the publisher

Name: Bushido: Yizhi
Description:
Yizhi of the three sisters is a nightmare for opponents that like to plan their lines of attack, her speed and unpredictability means such plans fail by her first onslaught. Yizhi chooses when and where she will engage the enemy. Any that attempt to isolate and pick off one of her sisters are likely to quickly find themselves outnumbered. During their long hunt they have learned the importance of supporting each other.
—description from the publisher

Name: Bushido: Yanjing
Description:
Yanjing is a formidable warrior in her own right. From a young age she had an affinity to the bow and her skills are impressive. Her calm zen archery produces impressive results, the arrows whispering across the battlefield as quietly as the falling blossom. Her ability to heal her sisters is of vital importance to their mission and without it they would have had to have given up on their quarry a long time ago.
—description from the publisher

Name: Bushido: Ying-Jian
Description:
Ying-Jian is the eldest of the three brothers and naturally Shuohuang and Shenzhiqi look to him for leadership. At a nod from Ying-Jian the three operate in unison. He has always been an able swordsman however years of being on the run, hunted down, have worn away at his honour as much as his constitution. He has developed skills and techniques not taught in any koryu but earned doing whatever it takes to survive.
—description from the publisher

Name: Bushido: Shenzhiqi
Description:
Shenzhiqi is the youngest of the three and in honesty without his brothers he would have fallen or been captured moons ago. That said he is as important to them as they are to him, together they push each other to greater feats and when fighting alongside each other they become a seemingly unstoppable force. Where Ying-Jian has foregone some of the niceties of their upbringing Shenzhiqi has somehow managed to maintained his moral compass.
—description from the publisher

Name: Bushido: Shuohuang
Description:
Shuohuang is considered one of the greatest swordsmen in the empire, he has surpassed all kenjutsu masters who ever taught him and any samurai with any skill with a blade will know his name. He is a living legend. Like his brothers though Shuohuang is tired from being chased across the empire, only his sheer doggedness and determination to live motivates him to go on. Many would like the scalp of Shuohuang, none have succeeded yet.
—description from the publisher

Name: Bushido: Baichi
Description:
Baichi lives to support the brothers. Where others may have slunk off into the night he has been steadfast in his loyalty and devotion. He is vital for their cause and the brother’s know it, many a time he has allowed them to achieve unexpected feats on the battlefield. His importance is such that even his master Shenzhiqi will throw his body on the line in order to protect him and keep the supply lines open.
—description from the publisher

Name: Wendake: Promo Tiles
Description:
Wendake: Promo Tiles is a set of two tiles that were included in all games sent to Kickstarter backers and available for free with a purchase of the game at the 2017 SPIEL and Lucca fairs. The tiles are:

				
				
					Level 1 Action tile:No effect when activated on the Action side.
Ritual side works normally.
Worth 4 points at the end of the game.

				
				
					Level 3 Progress tile:At any point during your turn, you may move up to 2 points between any two Score Tracks of your choice.

Name: Catacombs: Resurrection Pack 1
Description: Resurrection Pack 1 including Chicks in a Catacomb heroes (Amazon, Fire Mage, Forest Sprite, Huntress plus her wolf companion), Flame Antient and the Zombie Horde monsters. Includes additional spell and ability cards. Requires Catacombs Third Edition, heroes compatible with Catacombs & Castles. 27 cards in total.

Name: Hubywoky Le commencement
Description:
Hubywoky Le commencement is the first card game that integrate “continuous gaming” concept, i.e. which encourage you to play physically with your friends then to earn points online when you are alone, then to go back to your friends…and so on!

Hubywoky is an evolutive strategic 2 or 3 players card game where all cards are double-sided and uniques.

Each player has to strategically built 3 stacks of 4 cards (2 stacks of 4 cards for 3 players), thinking about sequences (Bonus and monsters) and above all remembering it when playing to counter his opponent’s plans and empty his stacks!

You can play at the board game only, or participate to the worldwide competition with the "Hubywoky Challenge" app.

Description from the publisher

Name: Socks!: The Game
Description:
Socks! The Game is a 4-6 player card game where you learn the horrible truth about why socks go missing.

In this game, players are the goblins responsible for stealing all those socks that we find missing after a good happy laundry day. The goblins seek to bring these artifacts of power to their employer, in the hopes of ascending to become incredibly important. We are not sure that is what they would get, should they succeed.

The game starts with players being handed out action cards, which empower them to collect socks, sabotage others or put them out of action. The objective is to get 5 un-paired socks in one's possession. Should pairs occur, the player is doomed to have to discard them...

—description from the publisher

Name: The Star-Struck City
Description:
The Star-Struck City sets players in the sunken ruins of Casa-Omnicidi, now called Perditus; a Primavantor city of incredible wealth recently risen from the seabed. Treasure and danger alike await your warbands, as they travel through the waterlogged city in search of the shards of the meteor that struck down the once-mighty port city and drove it beneath the waves.

Star-Struck City is a skirmish game, designed around playing with small warbands of 5-15 models on a 4′ x 4′ table loaded with terrain. Warband members advance, gaining new skills, equipment, and injuries as they survive the rigors of battle in this deadly locale. Climb up buildings and run between rooftops, leap down to ambush enemies from above, hire war machines and epic heroes from the Kings of War armies, and build your warband’s reputation as the fiercest and toughest fighters in all of Mantica.

The rules are based heavily on Kings of War, so players of the full-size wargame should feel right at home. It’s heavily inspired by other skirmish games such as Mordheim, but with the ease-of-play the Kings of War rules provide so gameplay is quick and decisive.

As the surviving veterans of The Star-Struck City have said: Perditus now only offers riches or death. What will you find?

—description from the publisher

Name: Freedom of Speech: The Game
Description:
The kind of party game you probably shouldn’t play with your mother. Freedom of Speech is a hilarious card game that almost guarantees that you will laugh and have a good time. The game comes with a deck of 400 cards, each containing a bizarre and silly word, a timer and instructions. Every other person around the table is on the same team and the rotation moves counter-clockwise. The deck stays at the center of the table and whoever has their turn draws from the deck. The aim is to get your teammates to guess the word on the card before the timer runs out. However, you cannot say the word that is on the card. In addition, there are other rules, like no rhyming or pointing, that you can find in the full instructions on the website. Finally, once your team guesses the word, the play moves to the other team immediately. The first team to guess 21 cards correctly wins.

—description from the designer

Name: Schoolgirls Love Tentacles: Aitako
Description: Promo Card from Delicious Orange featuring a Wild Card character "Aitako"

Name: Crooks: Crime Wave
Description:
A promo expansion for Crooks - new edition (WGG 1201-02)

These six expansion cards (included in the game Matryoshka) replace the six cards in the base game that share portraits. The rules for these new cards are:

Racketeer
Each Racketeer shows a bonus or penelty on its left and right edges. During scoring phase, the number on its right edge affects the value of the target to its immediate right, and the number on its left edge affects the value of the target to its immediate left.

Turncoat
At the end of the game you must decide which of these two gangs this Crook is a member of. If multiple Turncoats are in the game, they must choose their affiliation from highest to lowest rank.

Name: Meine kleine Märchen Memo Box
Description: Meine kleine Märchen Memo Box includes three fairy tales: Hansel and Gretel, Snow White, and Little Red Riding Hood. Each fairy tale is split up into twelve scenes, which is twelve memo cards. The players choose one of the three sets and place the memo cards facedown in the middle of the table. Each player tries to turn over the memo card with the number 1 on it. If they succeed, they try to turn over the next highest memo card. If they don’t succeed, their turn is over. The aim is to turn over all twelve memo cards in the right order, which is the order of the fairy tale. Whoever does this first wins.

Name: Alien Poltergeist
Description:
In the year 2240, corporate raiders have moved from the wall street to space. The two most infamous corporate raiders, the ruthless Conny Black and the guileful Rothchildes are on the front lines of this new war.

Overview
Two players take control of rival alien crews in a constant struggle to rule the grid. As the leader of a crew, you will increase your reputation and damage your opponent’s in three key ways:
1) Controlling the grid by converting it to your crew’s color
2) Using remote exploits to damage your opponent’s system
3) Hacking into your opponent’s mainframe and stealing valuable data

Objective
There are a limited amount of REP tokens in the general supply. The player with the most REP when the token supply runs out wins!

Name: All Your Base: Last Of Last – The Card Game
Description:
All Your Base: Last Of Last The Card Game is a fast-paced 2 to 6 player game pitting players against each other to see who will rule the universe by capturing “All Your Base”. Fight using Zig fighters, Battle Cruisers, Dreadnoughts, and the Zero Wing ship. It’s not all as it seems, there are RED ALERT cards that can throw your plan awry.

Hop across the universe in the mother of all ships, The Zero Wing itself or the many, many zipping Zigs to capture ALL YOUR BASE from Alpha to Omega. A fun filled strategic game with 104 cards and no dice. You gotta use your own bio-analog computing device (i.e. your brain) to win.

Name: Cyberball 2072
Description:
In the year 2065, people had grown bored of watching regular football. The athletes had devolved into overpaid, drug-addicted illiterates. Desperate to find a new impact sport for the masses, the TV networks sanctioned a think-tank of programmers, machinists, engineers, military experts, and game theorists. 
Within two years, the game of Cyberball had been born.  
     
The whiny, mentally stunted athletes of football had been replaced by 18 feet tall gleaming robots, adorned with spikes and sponsor adverts. These robo-athletes did not complain, ask for more money, do drugs, or get arrested.....they just rocked! And rock they did. In little time, the Cyberball League far eclipsed the popularity of all other sports combined. The crunch of metal on any given Sunday combined with spectacular explosions garnered fans from every walk of life. Soon, the Cyberball League included dozens of teams from all over the world. The corporations pumped millions of credits into this monster they had created and reaped huge rewards.

Now the year is 2072, and Cyberball is the most anticipated sport on the planet. All teams compete for the Cyberbowl at season's end, where the two top teams slug it out for the coveted 'Assassin's Cup'. As a Cyberball coach, it is your job to secure the best sponsors and coach your team to the promise land. The season can be grueling for a rookie coach. Use earned credits to your advantage and field the best players, while destroying other team's star players. Embrace the thrill of giant metal machines mauling each other. Become a Cyberball coaching legend!


                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                
                                                                                                                                                                                                                            
                                                                                                                                                                                                                        
                                                                                                                                                                                                                    
                                                                                                                                                                                                                
                                                                                                                                                                                                            
                                                                                                                                                                                                        
                                                                                                                                                                                                    
                                                                                                                                                                                                
                                                                                                                                                                                            
                                                                                                                                                                                        
                                                                                                                                                                                    
                                                                                                                                                                                
                                                                                                                                                                            
                                                                                                                                                                        
                                                                                                                                                                    
                                                                                                                                                                
                                                                                                                                                            
                                                                                                                                                        
                                                                                                                                                    
                                                                                                                                                
                                                                                                                                            
                                                                                                                                        
                                                                                                                                    
                                                                                                                                
                                                                                                                            
                                                                                                                        
                                                                                                                    
                                                                                                                
                                                                                                            
                                                                                                        
                                                                                                    
                                                                                                
                                                                                            
                                                                                        
                                                                                    
                                                                                
                                                                            
                                                                        
                                                                    
                                                                
                                                            
                                                        
                                                    
                                                
                                            
                                        
                                    
                                
                            
                        
                    
                
            
        
    


The futuristic and brutal world of Cyberball comes to life with this miniatures game. Choose a sponsor, upgrade your players, and prepare for gridiron mayhem.

The goal of this game is to outscore and brutalize the other team to receive monetary bonuses from the league and sponsors. Football fans will find themselves right at home with this 2 player game. To win games, you must score touchdowns. Once in possession of the ball, the offense has six plays to diffuse the ball by either passing midfield or getting in the endzone. The ball gradually heats up: cool - lukewarm - warm - hot - sizzling - critical. If a critical ball is not diffused, it will explode at the conclusion on the play. If a robo-athlete is holding the ball, they will be obliterated. The game is 7 on 7 robot football with a colorful cast of characters. Here are brief descriptions of the deadly participants:

QB - The offensive captain is the linchpin of any good team. Unlike other robo-athletes, the Quarterback has legs which allow for quick lateral movement, but not flat out speed. The QB's weakness is its dreadful lack of armor.

RB - An outstanding combination of speed and armor. The Runningback is often the workhorse of the offense. Many coaches find that an upgraded RB becomes a scoring machine.

PB - A new addition to Cyberball, the Powerback is gaining popularity across the league. Being able to run or pass the ball, make the PB an unpredictable asset.

WR - Perhaps the greatest offensive threat on the gridiron, the Wide Receiver is a true speed demon. Although lightly armored, a WR speeding down the field with the ball is rarely caught.

TE - Tight Ends are cheap to produce and make good supplemental blockers on the line of scrimmage. Some coaches are able to use TEs to good effect in a short passing game.

LM - Lineman are the bullies of the gridiron. Their main responsibilities are to block along the offensive line and make tackles along the defensive line. On tracks, they are slow but very maneuverable.

CB - The fastest player on the defense is the Cornerback. They are primarily charged with covering the elusive WRs and making an occasional blitz. What they lack in armor, they make up for with speed.

SF - Safeties are equally good at stopping the run or covering the pass. With respectable armor and above average speed, a good SF can be counted on to stop the offense dead in their tracks.

LB - The intimidator of the gridiron, Linebackers have very think armor and decent speed. Although able to cover short passes, these monsters are better at dominating the line of scrimmage and dismantling opposing QBs.

Teams in the Cyberball league utilize sponsors to supplement their income. It is a symbiotic relationship. Teams make thousands of credits each season for slapping sponsor decals onto their robo-athletes. Sponsors get valueable exposure on national TV. Deals are struck between each game and it is not uncommon to see a team switch sponsors frequently. Each coach selects one sponsor before the game.

This can be played as a stand-alone game as well as in season mode. In season mode, players can save up their money to buy bigger and better bots.

Name: Sheriff of Nottingham: Prince of Thieves
Description:
Prince of Thieves is a single card worth 15 gold.

The promo was given out at Origins 2017.

Name: Monopoly: Signature Token Collection
Description: This version of Monopoly comes in a silver tin.  The rules for Monopoly are unchanged.  The board, and community chest /chance cards, are black with gold print.  The hotels are gold colored and the houses are silver colored, which are stored in a cloth bag.  Contains 64 tokens: 56 gold and 8 silver.  The money is updated with the signature collection "M" logo.

Name: Heroes of Pterro
Description:
Glory or ruin—what do the cards hold for you?

Will you be heroes or villains? The choice is yours!

Using cards similar to a traditional Tarot deck, players vie to form parties of adventurers and complete quests while preventing others from doing the same!

Heroes of Pterro is an Adventuring Party Card Game for 3 to 5 players, ideal for 30 minutes of fast-paced fun and competition.

—description from the publisher

Name: The Scroll of Umbra
Description:
Umbra is a tabletop rogue-like set in a dungeon. Players choose between 4 classes or playing the monsters. The classes include the wizard,, who moves like a knight from chess and can pass over other pieces or walls; the warrior, who moves parallel with the edges and can move two spaces; the rogue, who moves diagonally and may leave or re-enter the game; and the princess who may choose how she moves.
The monsters are kobolds and goblins. Kobolds move parallel to the edges of the board. Goblins move diagonally. The monster player gets a piece for each player, and may move each piece 1 time per turn. Monsters controlled by another player can hunt players for points. Each player is worth 5 points to the monster player.
Players control peices that navigate an 8"x8" board using dice to determine if a space is a trap, a wall, or a hall. Sometimes player obtain treasure or gold. Gold is used to determine points at the end of the game. Treasure is represented by cards drawn from the treasure deck. Players determine the effect a treasure has when it is used. This causes the treasures to change each game. The game concludes after all players have exited or have been captured. The surviving player with the most points wins.

Name: Monikers: Twelve Hopelessly Stupid Fourth Rounds
Description:
It is a pack of cards that all have different fourth round rules. Like getting behind a couch and doing hand puppets. Or doing charades in pairs, but one person has to pose the other person. They're hilarious and weird and perfect for when you're having such a good time that you want a game to go on for just a little bit longer.

It was a Kickstarter exclusive (at least initially) for the "Monikers: The Shut Up & Sit Down Nonsense Box" campaign.

Name: Star Wars: Galaxy Hunt
Description: Carefully remove pieces from the spring loaded play area. If you get a piece with a negative number keep it no matter what. If you get one with a positive number AND no other pieces move then keep the positive piece; otherwise discard.  If other pieces jump out of the tray keep all negative and discard all positive. Highest score wins.

Name: Six Feet Under
Description:
Be the first to bury the newly departed with six layers of dirt before your opponent does. Shovel their dirt away to prevent them from winning, use a daisy card to pick a card from your opponents hand, and collect three Grave Robber cards to steal a buried coffin from them!

A simple pattern matching card game, players take turns playing Dirt Cards from their hand of six, trying to match the last played pattern. Match the pattern, use wild cards, or discard and draw to try and get the card you need. The first to place six Dirt Cards wins that round. First to bury 6 (or 3 for a quicker game) wins!

Hand drawn pen and ink illustrations and patterns make up the artwork and design of this playfully macabre card game.

—description from the publisher

Name: Star Wars: X-Wing Miniatures Game – Resistance Bomber Expansion Pack
Description:
A strategic ordnance platform flown by brave Resistance pilots, the B/SF-17 heavy bomber arrives to X-Wing as a towering, large-base ordnance platform with room for one systems upgrade, one tech upgrade, and two bombs. In addition to its pre-painted miniature starship, the Resistance Bomber Expansion Pack provides a host of potential pilots and upgrades. In total, you’ll find four ship cards, thirteen upgrades, one condition card, a maneuver dial, and all the plastic and tokens you need to rain destructive ordnance upon the First Order!

—description from the publisher
Families: Game: Star Wars X-Wing Miniatures Game

Name: DropMix: Series 1 Discover Packs
Description:
Expand your mix and build your music collection with DropMix Discover Packs. Each pack includes 5 DropMix cards that can create a full song mix and more music mixing possibilities with the DropMix Music Gaming System (sold separately). There are 30 DropMix cards available to collect in each series featuring songs from top artists. Each pack of 5 sold separately.

Dropmix: Series 1 Discover Packs is a collection of 6 such packs. While the packaging of each pack is identical, they can be identified by the card showing through the front window of each pack.

Name: DropMix: Series 2 Discover Packs
Description:
Expand your mix and build your music collection with DropMix Discover Packs. Each pack includes 5 DropMix cards that can create a full song mix and more music mixing possibilities with the DropMix Music Gaming System (sold separately). There are 30 DropMix cards available to collect in each series featuring songs from top artists. Each pack of 5 sold separately.

Dropmix: Series 2 Discover Packs is a collection of 6 such packs. While the packaging of each pack is identical, they can be identified by the card showing through the front window of each pack.

Name: ASL Action Pack #13: ASL Oktoberfest XXXII
Description:
The ASLOK XXXII pack builds on the success of the ASL Oktoberfest XXX pack, and highlights the design and playtesting talents of Ohio’s finest. Guided by veteran playtesters and tournament directors Bret Hildebran and Bill Hayward, the expert scenario designers Bill Sisler and Pete Shelling bring us eleven scenarios ranging from 1939 Poland to 1945 Hungary, with stops in Ukraine, Russia, New Guinea, Burma, Italy, France, and Belgium along the way. Place names like Vistula, Balta, Luga, Bougainville, Myitkyina, Elba, Caen, Falaise, and Bastogne will all ring a bell. These scenarios will stretch your tactical knowledge and skills, with many different situations (although no night actions—so sad). Some are infantry only, one is armor only (almost), but most feature combined arms. Assault engineers with all their toys are featured, and the King of Battle makes its appearance in the form of offboard artillery in several scenarios. Along with the “typical” Russian, German, and American battles, these scenarios also involve Poles (both 1939 and 1944 versions), British, Japanese, Chinese, the Free French, and the SS (of all different squad types).

The two new boards bring added flexibility to the system and are integral to most of the scenarios. Board 78 is a true wilderness board (no buildings) featuring a brush-covered ridge along its length. Board 79 provides a new river, three to five hexes wide, with a village strung out along both banks. Both highlight the steady skills of Charlie Kibler and are sure to see wide use in future scenario design. With great boards and great scenarios, Action Pack #13 is sure to be a big hit.

—description from the publisher

Name: Big Fat Burger
Description:
Big Fat Burger moves you to the fast food bar. You play as cooks whose mission is to make as many burgers as possible. In successive rounds you will be able to fulfill orders placed by customers that get quickly annoyed with waiting. The unforeseen events will be added to your special cards as a tip.

It’s a fast card game in which in the following rounds, players reserve incoming orders, collect the necessary ingredients, prepare burgers and interfere with other players (thanks to special cards). Time to serve customers is limited and when it runs out players will face consequences.

—description from the publisher

Name: Mistfall: Hearthfire Inn Mini-Expansion
Description:
This is a mini-expansion, available at conventions and via BGG Store.

This is an alternative Haven Location. It starts the game revealed and Safe.

This Location is always Safe. After a Hero rests, the player may discard up to 2 cards from their hand, and draw 1 card for each card so discarded.

Name: Watch Ya' Mouth: Redneck Expansion #1
Description:
Go git your kids, git your mama and daddy, and get ready for a good time! All the Watch Ya Mouth fun you love, with a knee slappin’ twist…redneck style! If you’re huntin’ for your next family game night belly laugh, you just bagged it!

Redneck Expansion Pack beefs up the original Watch Ya’ Mouth party game
Hampered by mouthpieces, teams attempt to read and interpret silly phrases, like:
Country as cornbread
Way over yonder, and up a piece
Too poor to paint, too proud to whitewash
Watch Ya’ Mouth Redneck Expansion Pack comes with 155 rowdy, knee-slappin’ phrases. Our cards are strong and durable for years of hootin’ and hollerin’.

Name: Exodus: Proxima Centauri – Ymnighet Mini-Expansion
Description:
This is a planet hex promo tile for Exodus: Proxima Centauri, Edge of Extinction, and Event Horizon. It is available at conventions and via the BGG Store.

PROMO RULES:

Ymnighet is a Dual Resource planet. During setup, two separate dice are placed on the planet. During production, both resources are gained and tracked separately.

If playing without the Event Horizon expansion, you may use Ymnighet in place of a standard CP Planet hex.

Name: Dragonsgate College: Mini-Expansion
Description:
This is a mini-expansion for Dragonsgate College. It is available at conventions and in BGG Store.

This expansion consists of:
1 Professor tile
1 Apprentice tile
1 Room tile

Note: If the value of your Stealth skill drops below 0, treat it as if it was 0 for all intents and purposes.

Name: Shadowscape: New Enemies Mini-Expansion
Description:
This is a mini-expansion for Shadowscape. It is available at conventions and in BGG Store.

This mini-expansion consists of three Enemies:

1 Ghoren Shaman tile
1 Black Coven Caster tile
1 Undead Loremaster tile

NOTE: When in Hero Area these Enemies can be treated (including discarding) as either a Trophy or Treasure token.

Name: Goliadopoly
Description: Themed version of Monopoly based around Goliad, Tx

Name: Arkham Horror: The Card Game – Jenny Barnes Promo Cards
Description:
This is a set of four cards to add Jenny Barnes to Arkham Horror: The Card Game. They were included with copies of the novel Hour of the Huntress.

Two of the cards are merely alternate-art versions of the Jenny Barnes investigator cards found in Arkham Horror: The Card Game â€“ The Dunwich Legacy: Expansion. The other two are an alternate signature card (Green Man Medallion) and an alternate signature weakness card (Sacrificial Beast) for Jenny Barnes, offering additional deck-building options.
Families: Game: Arkham Horror – The Card Game
Game: Arkham Horror TCG – Books & Replacement Cards
Game: Arkham Horror TCG – The Dunwich Legacy
Series: Arkham Horror Files (Fantasy Flight Games)

Name: Ball Busters: Golf
Description:
This is a trivia card game with a golf theme. The deck of question cards is passed around the table with each player answering a question until there is an incorrect response. The deck then moves to the right with another player attempting to provide the answers. The first contestant to get three correct answers in a row is declared the winner.

Sample Card:

Question: The World Golf Hall of Fame is located in what Florida city?

Answer: St. Augustine

Includes cards, rules, and a storage box.

Name: Earth: Endgame
Description:
Scientist have discovered the fact that the sun will emit a solar burst, that will burn the earth crust and everything on it. The exact timing of the solar burst is not known, so the worlds 7 factions will franticly prepare for the coming doom by digging a base below earth where people can live until the earth yet again is habitable.

Each faction will build ”rooms” with special functionality (base cards), research technologies to improve their chances for survival (Tech cards) , and play action-cards to affect their own or other factions progress. An important part of the game is the centralized trading of resources between players.

—description of the publisher

Name: Shopkins Big Roll Bingo
Description:
Product Description
Shopkins Big Roll Bingo is a great way to play the one of the world's most popular games, with oversized dice that are much more fun than spinners and loads of your favorite Shopkins characters. Roll the oversized dice to find out which letter and character to look for on your card. Do you have Kooky Cookie in your “B” column? If you do, place a token there. If you roll a Shopping Cart instead of a letter you can cover the picture no matter where it is. The first player to cover five squares in a row wins. This easy-to-play game comes with 6 bingo cards, 2 oversized dice, 60 tokens and complete instructions. For 2-6 players ages 4 and up.

From the Manufacturer
Shopkins Big Roll Bingo is a great way to play the one of the world's most popular games, with oversized dice that are much more fun than spinners and loads of your favorite Shopkins characters. Roll the oversized dice to find out which letter and character to look for on your card. Do you have Kooky Cookie in your “B” column? If you do, place a token there. If you roll a Shopping Cart instead of a letter you can cover the picture no matter where it is. The first player to cover five squares in a row wins. This easy-to-play game comes with 6 bingo cards, 2 oversized dice, 60 tokens and complete instructions. For 2-6 players ages 4 and up.

Name: DropMix: Rock Playlist Pack (Ouroboros)
Description: The Rock Ouroboros playlist comes with 15 DropMix cards plus 1 hidden track card. This playlist features music from: Blink-182, Ed Sheeran, Evanescence, Panic! At the Disco, Walk the Moon, Weezer, and more.

Name: DropMix: Pop Playlist Pack (Derby)
Description: The Pop Derby playlist comes with 15 DropMix cards plus 1 hidden track card. This playlist features music from: Carly Rae Jepson, Gloria Gaynor, The Jackson 5, Meghan Trainor, Rick James, Sia, and more.

Name: DropMix: Hip-Hop Playlist Pack (Mirrors)
Description: The Hip-Hop Mirrors playlist comes with 15 DropMix cards plus 1 hidden track card. This playlist features music from: Ginuwine, Outkast, Salt-N-Pepa, Sean Paul, A Tribe Called Quest, The Weeknd, and more.

Name: DropMix: Electronic Playlist Pack (Astro)
Description: The Electronic Astro playlist comes with 15 DropMix cards plus 1 hidden track card. This playlist features music from: The Chainsmokers, Jason Derulo, LMFAO, MGMT, Miike Snow, Odesza, and more.

Name: Arena: For the Gods! – SuperHero Shield
Description: Promo card.  Allows you to push faraway Heroes.

Name: Arena: For the Gods! – Lasersword
Description: Promo card.  Deal -1 red cube to an adjacent Hero OR Push an adjacent Hero OR Move 1 space.

Name: Planet of the Apes: The Miniatures Boardgame
Description:
Welcome to Planet of the Apes!
In this immersive scenario-based cooperative game set between the second and third films of the Caesar trilogy, you and your friends lead a group of apes against human squads. Thanks to their familiarity with the forest, your apes use the terrain to hide, observe enemies from a distance, move with agility and climb on trees to gain strategic advantage. Humans, while hampered by their inability to climb, have superior technology that gives them considerable firepower. You'll constantly have to make the best tactical decisions, anticipate human actions, coordinate and help each other.

3D EXPERIENCE! Trees give your apes a huge tactical advantage! See without being seen, get bonuses, jump from tree to tree or even directly at your enemies!

SOLO PLAY Play solo and take on a variety of scenarios with adjustable difficulty levels.

TACTICAL COMBAT Your apes all have different weapons and abilities, making combat highly tactical and cinematic.

COOP Mutual aid and coordination between players are key! You must counter the enemy's firepower with cunning. anticipation, and coordinated action over multiple rounds.

In the shadows that darken between the ancient trees, a shiver runs through the forest that carries a bad omen.
An ape, breathless and his eyes filled with a wild urgency, makes his way through the undergrowth to reach the secret entrance beneath the waterfall that leads to the lair of his leader, Caesar.
The alarm is sounded: the horn of a small group of apes, located near a camp to the east, has been blown. The signal leaves no room for doubt; human patrols, thirsty for revenge since Koba's attack, have begun their assault. The targeted camp, a haven for the war wounded, is now in imminent danger.

"The humans are approaching, Caesar", the messenger mimics in sign language, panting. "Our brothers are holding their positions, but the enemies are numerous and well-armed."

Caesar, the figurehead of this endangered Eden, catches every word, his gaze sharp as flint. Without wasting a moment, he orders reinforcements to evacuate the wounded camp, while planning the fortification of the main refuge. Determined, Caesar picks up arrows, dips them into the embers of a nearby fire, and murmurs with unwavering resolve:

"You will not be the only ones to use fire tonight."

With agility that defies the treetops, he leaps through the branches, a shadow among shadows, ready to defend his people to the last breath.

APES TOGETHER STRONG

Name: Mischief Media: The Game of Fake News
Description:
Mischief Media is a social deduction, tabletop game designed around the deceptive world of journalism and politics where players try to manipulate each other in an attempt to push their agenda.

Each player takes on the role of a "Philanthropist" who influences different key characters of the media world to gain control over the public's interest. To gain control of a news cycle (ROUND), the player must gain a majority of the available viewers, be the only one left with viewers, or be the only one left with credibility. Win three news cycles and you have successfully pushed your agenda changing the public's opinion.

Each player starts the round with 2 Credibility Cards, 1 Collusion Card, 7 viewer chips, and 1 Action Card. These are the tools that are used to push your agenda.

There are six Credibility Cards, each with their own action, that are used to affect viewership or credibility. On your turn, you may choose to take an action of any Credibility Card whether you have that card or not. If you lose both Credibility Cards, you no longer have a reputable opinion and are out for the round.

Viewer chips represent how many people believe in your movement. Each player starts with 7 viewer chips. If you gain 20 viewer chips, then a majority agree with your opinions and you win the round. If you lose all of your viewer chips, then you have become no longer relevant and are out for the round.

If a player does an action of a Credibility Card that they do not have, then they are susceptible to being called out for their Fake News! If correctly called out for Fake News by an opponent, the player loses one of their Credibility Cards. If incorrectly called out for Fake News by an opponent, the opponent loses a Credibility Card.

Management of both viewers and credibility are key to success. Focus too much on credibility and a player could lose all their viewers. Focus too much on viewers and a player could lose all their credibility.

To turn the tide of the game, a player can use a Collusion Card. Collusion Cards come with a higher risk because it requires a specific set of Credibility Cards. Yet the reward is well worth it because the player gets to follow through with a special action.

As you become close to winning, the media has more watchful eye on your actions forcing you to draw a hidden Scrutiny Card. Scrutiny Cards change the way you play the game possibly forcing you to play truthfully or to play as a full on liar.

Once you have won three news cycles and successfully pushed your agenda, you get to tell your fellow melancholy media members what is now commonly accepted as truth i.e. "It is considered rude to greet a friend without using excessive JAZZ HANDS".

—description from the publisher

Name: Timeline: Polska – Gdańsk
Description:
You probably know the date of the Battle of Cedynia, but will you guess the date of the founding of the Free City of Gdansk?
 
There are 10 cards that deal with the events of over a thousand years of history in the region. Thanks to them you will get to know the history of Poland more and you will increase the attractiveness of the basic version of the game!

—description from the publisher (translated)

Zapewne znasz datÄ™ Bitwy pod CedyniÄ…, ale czy odgadniesz datÄ™ powstania Wolnego Miasta GdaÅ„ska?
 Przed Wami 10 kart, które dotyczÄ… wydarzeÅ„ zwiÄ…zanych z ponad tysiÄ…cletniÄ… historiÄ… regionu. DziÄ™ki nim jeszcze lepiej poznacie historiÄ™ naszej ojczyzny i zwiÄ™kszycie atrakcyjnoÅ›Ä‡ podstawowej wersji gry!

—description from the publisher (Polish)

Name: The 7th Continent: The Flying Roots
Description:
The Flying Roots expansion includes 40 Cards and 6 Flying Roots figures.

This add-on’s effects are tied directly to the Action Deck.

When you begin a game including The Flying Roots, you add the Flying Roots cards to the action deck. When a Flying Root figure is on your Terrain card, if you draw one of these cards whilst attempting to resolve an action, a Flying Root will appear on your Terrain card. What do they do? You will have to research and observe them to find out!

Name: Blood on the Blade
Description:
Blood on the Blade is a micro set of rules for solitaire or co-op skirmish game, set on a fantasy background, but can also be used for non-fantasy games (planned expansions will cover Middle-Ages and Dark Ages, possibly Samurai era).

The “Micro” refers to the small set of rules, the small time required to complete one game session and the small number of miniatures required (4-10 figures being a common range). Many micro-details are left to the player, only the “important” rules are included in the twelve pages of the game.

The game includes nine Scenarios, covering classical wargame scenes like searching for loot, attacking an enemy base, defending your territory, freeing prisoners. Event markers placed on the Map will create the needed Fog of War and randomize the placement of enemies, events and of course loot!

Scenarios can be played individually or as part of a Campaign game: in this case a flowchart will (randomly) determine the next mission; as an example, after a “Scout” mission a bad roll could send your characters on the “Ambush” scenario. Characters on a Campaign will be able to improve their characteristics, but with the improvement of the Reputation Level of your Warband, your enemies will also become stronger.

Activation of units (friendly and enemies) is managed with a pool of activation markers, but you can never be sure that every unit will be activated. When an “Enemy” marker is drawn by the pool you will roll on the ENEMY ACTIVATION table in the current Scenario to determine the unit to activate and its orders.

—description from the designer

Name: Guild Ball: Heralds of the Winter's Moon
Description: Light on their feet and menacing as the cold, this pack of hunters brings the sharp sting of winter to the sport. Their fearsome captain, Skatha, commands the pitch with slick footwork and a passing game as unrelenting as winter's howling winds. Opponents had best be wary with the ball against her pack. One misstep and their watchful protector Snow will fetch the ball and pass it to their feral striker, Ulfr. This lone huntsman lives for the rush of an ambush, targeting prey who stand between him and the goal post. To ensure their striker makes the shot, Veteran Hearne lies in wait, ready to ensnare his prey and show them the cruelty of winter. His furs now matted with frost, Hearne proves even the most ardent supporters of the Sun Father can be swayed by the Winter Queen.

Name: Booz Mooz
Description:
SUMMARY
Booz Mooz is a party game with cards, where players let each other take sips or drinks (alcoholic or non-alcoholic) in a sly and playful way.

INTRODUCTION - theme
Every year, in some deep dark forest, all mooz of the world gather for the great Mooz Fest. A gathering so secret even we don't really know what happens there. All we know things tend to get quite rough. All mooz (players) are eager to have a nice drink (or two, or three, or more...) but the real boozers get lost in the forest. Their follow-mooz cannot wait to find them and lush up together. Are you curious about what kind of mooz you are going to meet? Before you know it, you are in a world of choices, speed, agility and above all: lots of fun!

GOAL
The goal of the game is simple: The player who has the least blood alcohol content (bac) points when the game ends, wins. The game ends when all cards are face up.

GAMEPLAY
STEP 1: Gather some friends and take a seat. Clear the table.
STEP 2: Make sure everyone has a glass and fill this glass with a drink of choice.
STEP 3: Spread all cards on the table face down.
The youngest player starts the game by turning a card of choice face up. Turns go clockwise until all cards are face up.

Does the Question Mooz has it in for you? Or are you, as Royal Mooz, calling the shots? Are you a Gentlemooz or do you steal booz from your neighbors? Everything is possible, as long as you finish the game as the mooz with the least points.

Servant Mooz, another round please!

Name: Dixit 8: "Cocktail" Promo Card
Description: The card shows several people floating on pool toys in a glass with a yellowish-green cocktail.

Name: Welt 97: Expansion Set
Description:
Expansion for Welt 97

Contains randomly chosen

3 cardboard strips
2 sticker strips

Name: Elder Sign: Arkham Nights 2017 Promotional Investigator Cards
Description:
Two new, official, Investigator cards, given to attendees of the Arkham Nights event held on 13-15 October 2017.

Consists of new versions of both Monterey Jack and Ursula Downs, two investigators
Families: Series: Arkham Horror Files (Fantasy Flight Games)

Name: Multiplying Like Rabbits
Description:
It's mating season, and these rabbits are getting out of control!

A quick and easy 18 Card Micro-Game, you and your opponent square off trying to be the first to empty their hands of proliferating rabbit cards.

Each player is dealt 9 random cards, some female and some male rabbits. Cards must be played in order that they appear in your hand, top to bottom. Simultaneously you play your card..
2 Males: they stay in the pile
2 Females: they stay in the pile
1 Male 1 Female: They Mate!! The player who played the lower numbered card must take the entire pile of played rabbit cards!

Play continues in this fashion until one players hand is empty and is declared the winner.

—description from the designer

Name: Erect7
Description:
Erect7 is a game that celebrates romance, intimacy, and giant throbbing boners that erupt like fire hoses of love! This game is for 2-4 adult players and a single game takes 10-15 minutes to play. The action is fast, furious and naughty, as you and your opponent race to create the ultimate erection and money shot in 7 cards.

—desciption from the designer

Name: Envy
Description:
Envy is a fast paced, hysterically inappropriate competition to prove your manhood. This is a take that style card game where each player constructs a "member" and the longest wins. There are 3 types of cards...growth that make it larger, shrinkage that will make it smaller and a cockblock that will stops an action from happening. This is an in your face silly humor fun card game. The game can be just one round or a full game where for each player there is a round of play and the highest total wins the game.

—description from the publisher

Name: Bitter Woods 3rd Edition
Description:
Bitter Woods 3rd Edition was published and sold briefly in 2002 as a professional DTP effort by designer Randy Heller.

Only 200 copies were sold before a contract to publish a Deluxe L2 Design Group version stopped further sales, making this one of the more desirable acquisitions among game collectors.

The game includes a color booklet and full color 1/2" counter sheet, includes historical articles, random events, and game scenarios.

This edition only supplies updated rules and counters, no other components are included therefore a copy of a previous edition is required for use!
Families: History: World War II (Battle of the Bulge)
Players: Wargames with Rules Supporting Only Two Players

Name: Crazy Cafe
Description:
Each player will spin the spinner and stack the dishes on the table accordingly. When you land on “pull” you must pull the tablecloth without the dishes flying everywhere!

You must successfully remove the tablecloth from the table, but the trick is that you can’t move the dishes first. The first person to remove the tablecloth without knocking down the whole dinner is the winner of the game. You can either start with a full table or build up to one. Do a round with just one dish and then add them as you go along.

Name: The Walking Dead: All Out War – Equipment Booster
Description: This pack contains 55 Equipment Cards to kit out your Survivor group. There are lots of useful core items like the .38 Revolver and Football Pads, as well as a selection of exciting preview items from later in the story, like the Riot Gear and M16. Finally, there are some brand new unique cards, like the Makeshift Padding that can protect you from bites, and a Glass Bottle that you can throw to make noise!
Families: Game: The Walking Dead – All Out War

Name: 10 Minute Heist: Scarab
Description:
Kickstarter limited exclusive.

"Until the start of your next turn, players may not steal cards from the floor your Thief token occupies."

Name: Toi-Toi, die Grabenhopser
Description:
The game board is divided in half by a moat. Each side is the home side of a player with a house of 3x3 spaces. The goal of the game is to get one's own pawns into the house of the opposing player. The pawns marked with a letter (T, o, i) have to get on the spaces with the same letters.

Movement is 1 space diagonal forward or backward. Inside the houses movement is allowed in any direction. Movement over the moat is only possible by jumping over an own pawn (without letter) which has been positioned inside the moat as a bridge. These "bridge-pawns" may only leave the moat, when all other friendly pawns have crossed over.

Name: Dragoonium
Description:
A fantasy themed set matching card game similar to rummy.

Players try to collect the most gold by playing sets of matching cards during their turns.  Each player plays as one of 9 Champions(colors), each one has different abilities that effect game play, and what cards are used to create the deck. Each hand follows a simple draw-play-discard pattern until someone runs out of cards, at which point gold (score) is counted.

—description from the publisher

Name: Wacky Willy's Word Warehouse
Description:
The objective of Wacky Willy’s Word Warehouse is to complete your Word-O-Gram before your opponents and read aloud the ridiculous story it manufactured. Word-O-Grams are ridiculous stories with missing components, Who, what, When, Where and Why. Each player will get a complete 5-set of each of the Word-O-Gram’s missing categories. Category cards are to be kept separately.  Wordsmiths will take turns rolling the die which will determine which category is played that round. The category will display an unrelated question in which you compete for the best answer. The winning Wordsmith of that round gets to add the answer to their Word-O-Gram in the matching category. Once they have one of each category, the Word-O-Gram’s story will be readable and complete. If a player gets 5 of the same category they may trade 4 in to get one they are missing. Remember, the goal in playing cards is not only to get picked but mainly to complete your Word-O-Gram, so choose cards that will impress your opponents but also play well with your story.

—description from the publisher

Name: Stellar Express
Description:
The objective of Stellar Express is to gain the most victory points by completing missions. The game ends once a set amount of victory points is achieved during game play. Collect missions at star bases and transport resources from those star bases to planets. Reach the planets before you run out of fuel. Expand your fuel and other ship’s needs by hiring crew and purchasing ship modifications. Every round of turns triggers the orbit of the planets. Calculate the distance in your head, creating strategies to get to your destination in time!

—description from the publisher

Name: Corruption
Description:
Each player will play as a corporation fostering particular political priorities such as Healthcare, Finance, Military, Foreign Affairs and Education. Each Bill will either benifit you or hinder your opponent. Use your vast wealth and influence to bend politicians to your will. Buy, bribe, cheat, steal and undermine your opponents as you try to gain the most profits. Using influence and lobbying powers,  players will compete to influence the passing of bill. The winner is the corporation to have the most money at the end of the game.

—description from the publisher

Name: MasterSweets
Description:
MasterSweets is an easy to learn, fast to play, family-friendly card game with great repeatability.
MasterSweets has four different game variants: competitive, player elimination, cooperative and solo.

In the main competitive variant of the "MasterSweets" you will take up the role of one of the 16 fancier confectioners(each with different special ability), competing to present the best confectionery delights. 
"MasterSweets" Gameplay
Beginning with the starting player, players take turns in clockwise order. On his turn the player has to take one of the following actions:

1 – Take a card from the market into his hand. 
2 – Take the top card of the drawing deck.
3 – Alter a recipe from the cookbook by exchanging one of the ingredient cards in his hand with a card from the cookbook.
4 – Play a special card from his hand. 
5 – Perform the special skill of his role.
6 - Complete a recipe. Give all the ingredients compiling a recipe to complete it.

Each recipe gives a certain number of points which equals the sum of the points of ingredient cards that compiles the recipe. At the end of the game the player who has collected the most victory points, wins.

In the elimination game “Clash of Sweets” each player will create their own unique cookbook and will try to steal their opponents‘ recipes. This way, he reveals other players‘ culinary secrets and their unique cookbooks decreases. After the last recipe from a player’s cookbook is stolen, the player must leave the game. The last surviving player with recipes that have not been revealed is the winner.

In “Clash of Sweets” the active player allowed actions are:
1 – Take a card from the market.
2 – Take the top card of the drawing deck.
3 – Play a special card.
4 – Exchange an ingredient card from his hand with a card from another player’s cookbook. 
5 – Improve a card in his cookbook. This way a recipe form the cookbook becomes more difficult for stealing. 
6 – Steal an opponent’s recipe.

In the cooperative variant - “Sweets workshop” a royalty has noticed our masters of the sweets. She wants them to make incredible sweets for her birthday. Now the players must combine their efforts and team up in order to exactly fulfill all the royal’s requirements.
In “Sweets workshop” each player will hold the cards in his hand facing the rest of the players. The other players will give him clues about his cards.

In “Sweets workshop” the active player allowed actions are:
1 – Point a card from the cookbook and then discard a card from his hand. If the discarded card is of the same type as the one that has been pointed at, turn the cookbook card face down.
2 – Discard a card from his hand and exchange the position of 2 cards from the cookbook. 
3 – Discard 2 cards from his hand in order to discard a card from the cookbook. Replace the discarded cookbook card with a new card from the drawing deck.
4 – Discard a card from his hand in order to give a clue to another player, what cards he holds in his hand. The active player must indicate – by pointing – which cards he is offering a clue about. Two types of clues are allowed:
A) A clue about one, and only one value. For example: “You have ‘5’ point cards, here and here and …”. 
B) Point a recipe in the cookbook. Afterwards, the active player should point out all cards from one team-mate hand that are of the same type as at least one card from the selected row or column. For example: “Here and here and here … you have the same cards like in this recipe”.

At the end of the game, if all the cards in the cookbook are face down, then the queen is happy and all players win together. Otherwise the game is lost.

To be a true master of the sweets, you need a lot of workouts. The best workout is when you are confronted with your own best achievements.
The solo variant “Lonely in the kitchen” is the same like “MasterSweets” for two players. The goal in the “Lonely in the kitchen” is the player to collect more victory points than George “The cake” (his fictional opponent) at the end of the game.

Name: Roll and Cover
Description:
An educational game to help students practice addition and subtraction math facts.

Choose one of the three boards available boards, each with slightly different rules.

In the basic form of the game, players each start the game with 10 cubes.  On your turn, you roll the dice, sum them, and find that space.  If the space is blank, put one of your cubes there.  If it has one cube of another color, bump that cube -- replace it with your cube and return the bumped cube to its owner.  If it has 2 cubes (of any color), miss your turn.  If it has one cube of your color, put a second there and 'lock' the space -- it is now safe from being bumped.  The first player to get rid of all their cubes wins.

On other boards, players roll 2 dice and take the difference or roll 3 dice and take the sum of all 3.

The game can be played with more than 2 players if each starts with fewer cubes (3 players use 7 each, 4 players us 5 each).

This game has been made freely available online as a print-and-play.

The game can be played in a less aggressive fashion by giving each player their own board.  On your turn, roll and cover the appropriate space.  The first player to cover a specified number of spaces wins.  In that form the game is called "Roll and Cover" instead of "Bump".

Name: G.O.L.E.M.
Description:
End of the 19th century, ownership of every inch of land or mountain on Earth has been defined with astonishing accuracy by the four superpowers of the world: the English empire, the French Third Republic, the Prussian/German empire and the powerful United States.
Nationalism is the dominant ideology and every country is constantly looking for that economical or scientific competitive advantage that would shift the balance of power in their favour.
In this climate, Mars becomes the new frontier. The journey to Mars is however long and demanding. Also, the planet is not suitable for human life. Therefore the brightest minds of Earth concluded that if humans cannot be transferred to Mars, some new special robotic machine will prepare the ground for them.

And so GOLEMs (Gear Operated Looting and Exploring Machines) appear.
Their mission: to explore the Red planet, extract its resources and build structures suitable for human colonisation. Once deployed, GOLEMs will follow their programed mission: extract resources, improve their design, build colonies and destroy enemies indefinitely until one day their creators will land on the red planet and turn them off.
Until then, GOLEMs are the only Lords of planet Mars…

G.O.L.E.M. is a steampunk themed, card driven, battle and colonisation game featuring a modular map, high quality miniatures and superior artwork.

—description from the publisher

Name: Pictionary Junior: Play it With Clay
Description:
This edition combines the fun of charades with modeling clay.

The object is to guess a word from the sculpture made by your teammates. Every time a word is correctly guessed, that teams advances on the board. The first team to the finish space wins.

The top card is turned over and both teams sculptors look at the word on the card. The timer is turned over and both teams begin sculpting and guessing at the same time. The first team to correctly guess spins the spinner and advances to the color indicated

If no teams gets it in the alloted time, a new card is drawn and the process is repeated.

The first team to the finish space wins.

Name: Castle Crush! The Card Game
Description: In Castle Crush! The Card Game, which is based on Castle Crush!, players build their own castles and take pleasure in demolishing the castles of others.

Name: Black Stories: Superheroes Edition
Description:
Black Stories are fiddly, morbid and mysterious riddles for teenagers and adults. The players try to reconstruct the crime by asking, guessing and fiddling about. A spooky card game just right for any party.

Black Stories: Superheroes Edition includes fifty new raven-black mysteries for you to puzzle out.

Name: Black Stories: Mörderische Bescherung
Description: Black Stories are fiddly, morbid and mysterious riddles for teenagers and adults. The players try to reconstruct the crime by asking, guessing and fiddling about. A spooky card game just right for any party.

Name: Christmas Stories
Description:
Black Stories are fiddly, morbid and mysterious riddles for teenagers and adults. The players try to reconstruct the crime by asking, guessing and fiddling about. A spooky card game just right for any party.

Christmas Stories gives a holiday-themed version of this game.

Name: Żubr Pompik
Description:
Å»ubr Pompik is a memory kids game in which players try to gather as many flower sets as possible by receiving a reward for good memorising animals positions in the forest.

Every turn a player has to throw two dice and move "Å»ubr Pompik" (European Bison with a cute name "Pompik") on the path the number of spaces equal to one of the dice or both combined. Then the animal tile from the space the bison landed is revealed and put on the space the bison has started his turn. Now a player has to point the second animal of this kind by revealin appropriate tile. If they succeed then they get a flower tile in of the three colors randomly.

The game ends after a specific number of rounds when the bison walk around the forest. The player to gather most sets of three different flowers is the winner.

Name: Seelenchaos
Description:
Chaos in Hell! The soul contracts concluded by the demons have somehow got mixed up and the souls have been credited to the wrong demons. Since one can not even rely on the bureaucracy in hell, it is up to the demons themselves to get their property back. That would not be a problem, if demons were not so devious...

Seelenchaos (Chaos of Souls) is an unusual card game for 3 torn cross-thinkers, in which no player plays with his own cards, but with those of the right neighbor. The neighbor orders the card to be played by a player, but whether or not the card is really played, is left up to the demonic conscience alone. You get points for every trick you make, but the card itself goes back to its owner. And bring him the card value as points. You can not give the other demons the points, of course - it would be much better if the opponents' high cards burned each other.
The right assessment of the other players, clever tactics and a little luck at the right moment are necessary to gain the most points in this chaotic-confusing but highly tactical card game.

Name: DiceWar: Bond of Demons
Description:
Play DiceWar: Bond of Demons to step inside a dark kingdom. Unleash suffering and despair all over the warlands!

DiceWar: Bond of Demons is an expansion for the game DiceWar: Light of Dragons that contains a new tribe to fight against the other two existing tribes from Light of Dragons and Roots of Mali.

Name: Maccabees
Description:
Save the sacred jug of pure oil and win!

In the month of Kislev, after the Greecs captured the Temple, all the oils for the lighting the Tempel Menorah were defiled and only one small jug of oil remained.
Three Greecs with drawn swords are attempting to reach it and defile it too!
Who will save the last jug of oil!

A card game requring concentration and speed - and a bit of luck!

Name: Home of the Brave
Description:
Home of the Brave is a sociopolitical board game emphasizing the complexity of the world of modern U.S. politics. It's a 2-5 players tabletop game in which players will compete for influence, advance their professional position and gain powerful supporters. Driven by a story presented in a 18-page novella, the game creates a rich landscape where politics, media, social activism, business and criminal world mix. Home of the Brave is full of negotiation, blackmail, alliances and scandals.

The game takes place in rounds. Each round (except the first) starts with revealing a voting card (events) and voting for one of its two possible results. Then the players take turns doing actions (play a card, earn profit from previously played cards, advance on the path of bravery, etc.). When everyone has finished doing actions and has passed, the round ends - players draw new cards and reveal a new voting card. The primary player action is to play a card. Each character has their own deck of cards representing their typical behavior, acquaintances, and strengths. Each card has a cost (in resources) to play it, which is printed on the card. Skillful resource management and optimal card play is the key to victory in Home of the Brave.

A basic type of resource in the game is supporter cubes. They symbolize allies, voters, subordinates, or favors owed to a character. There are four types: Republicans, Democrats, Activists and Criminals.

Additional resource types are dollars and bravery points.

Players keep their own resources hidden behind screens so that opponents cannot see them. A player pays the cost of playing a card by paying the required resources from behind their screen to the bank. A player cannot play a given card if they do not have all the required resources.

The aim of the game is to gain 4 (or more) stars before one’s opponents. 2 stars can be gained by career advancement along the path of bravery, but each character also has many other ways to earn stars, mostly through their personal goal cards. Players will often have to prioritize between their career and private life.

Name: Pathfinder Adventure Card Game: "Edér" Promo Card
Description: Promotional ally card that is usable with any Pathfinder Adventure Card Game set. In addition, it has a code printed on it that can be redeemed for the same card in the Pathfinder Adventures video game.
Families: Series: Pathfinder Adventure Card Game (Paizo Publishing)

Name: Pathfinder Adventure Card Game: "Pallegina" Promo Card
Description: Promotional ally card that is usable with any Pathfinder Adventure Card Game set. In addition, it has a code printed on it that can be redeemed for the same card in the Pathfinder Adventures video game.
Families: Series: Pathfinder Adventure Card Game (Paizo Publishing)

Name: Scythe: Promo Pack #14 – Encounter Card 42
Description: This promo encounter card for Scythe was featured in The Secret Cabal Gaming Podcast's 2017 Kickstarter campaign.

Name: A Weaver in the Forest of Wyr
Description:
You are a Weaver of Wyr, responsible for herbal medicine and magic spells and potions. Your garden beneath the trees of Wyr grow the flowers and herbs you need for your craft.

In the time of harvest you set out to gather what you will require for those you care for. You have a day to harvest all you will need while trying to stop the mischievous Keiju from causing havok in your Garden.

If you can find the right combination of flowers and herbs to satisfy them, they will consider you a friend and move elsewhere.

To Win: 
The goal of the game is to harvest all but one of the Nature cards from the Garden and entice all the Keiju to leave.

Setup:
Shuffle the deck of 8 Keiju cards and draw 4 of them. Remove the others from the game. Place these 4 drawn Keiju on top of the pile of 44 Nature cards and shuffle this deck of cards and lay them out face up in 4 rows of 12 cards each This area is the Garden.

Leave room for 5 cards below these rows. This area is the Basket.

You will also create a discard pile - the Harvest - during the game.

To Play:
You may choose one of any two matching cards from any of the rows if your choice is: two adjacent cards within the rows, sharing the same suit or number OR if there are exactly two other adjacent Nature cards between the pair you are choosing to remove one of (Note: A Keiju card may not be one of these in between cards).

Only one of these two cards is chosen and is then placed either in the Harvest or the Basket. Each time you remove a card from a row, slide any cards to the right or left of the removed card to fill in any gaps across the rows. Cards are moved from the bottom rows upward or the top row downwards as a gap is filled.

The Harvest - This is a discard pile, you will receive one point for each card in this pile at the end of the game.

The Basket - Instead of placing cards in the Harvest you may place a card instead in one of 5 card ‘piles’ in your Basket. Cards in your Basket are used to entice the Keiju in your Garden to leave.

Keiju must be removed in numerical order, lowest to highest. If, at any time, cards on top of the piles in the Basket match a request as shown on the next consectuive numbered Keiju card in the Garden, you may remove that Keiju to the Harvest where it is worth 10 points at the end of the game.

The four or five cards used to bribe the Keiju are then removed from the game and will not score any points. Keiju do not have suits. They will form blocked areas in the rows of cards which can affect how you remove the suited cards.

As you play cards to the Basket you will cover up previous cards played there, which can then only be revealed once they are used to entice Keiju.

Scoring:
At game end you will receive:

1 point per Nature card in the Harvest.
10 points per Keiju in the Harvest.
Any Keiju left in the Garden are -5 points each.
Any Nature cards left in the Garden are -1 point each.
Cards remaining in the Basket count neither for nor against you.

This game can be played with a traditional card deck.

Name: Scopinion
Description:
Scopa meets deck-building, and tradition meets the modern spirit in Scopinion.

Each player starts the game with the same card deck. The cards are numbered from 0 to 7 and have negative spades. The goal is to enhance your deck with better numerical cards, to neutralize your 14 spades with hearts, and above all to buy target cards as they provide victory points. The player with the most victory points wins.

Scopinion includes simple rules for beginners and extended rules for expert gamers.

Name: The Epic Battle of Alesia
Description:
The Epic Battle of Alesia 52 BC is an old school classic hex and counter game that is designer Grant Wylie's reimagining of the Avalon Hill title, Caesar: Epic Battle of Alesia originally published in 1976.

The game allows players to refight Caesar's epic battle fought against the Gaul in 52 B.C., on a 34" x 44" hard mounted board.  Borrowing many concepts from the Avalon Hill title, the concepts have been simplified and clarified to make a smooth playing game that is good for 2 or more players, and if you are a gamer who doesn't mind playing both sides to the best of your ability, the game is very friendly.

WHAT'S INCLUDED:

Large beautiful box Box 
34" x 44" Hard mounted game board
4 counter sheets with large 3/4" counters with rounded corners
2 copies of the rules (one for each player)
1 six sided die
2 full color player aids
1 off board movement chart
1 plastic custom counter tray

Name: Adult XXX Charades
Description:
Adult XXX Charades is played like a regular charade game for the most part. The goal is to be the first team to reach 10 points and be declared winner.

After the teams are formed, the first team (chosen by determining who most recently had sex) selects an actor who then announces which phrase he/she will act out (1-6). Then that actor draws a charade card from a deck of the provided cards (before being able to see what the phrases are!)

Each of the six phrases on the charade cards are marked with a single "X", a double "XX" or a triple "XXX" which represents the potential difficulty of acting out/guessing that particular phrase.  A single "X" will be alloted one run through of the provided 60 second sand timer. The double "XX" will run through the sand timer one full time and then flip for a second run through.  The triple "XXX" designation shall allow the team to have a third sand timer run through. Regardless of which level "X" is assigned, the point alloted for a correctly guessed phrase is one.  The "X" designation simply allows for more or less time during the acting out/guessing phase and does not impact scoring.

The phrases often can be acted out using very common gestures, but some will be nearly impossible to portray without performing a lewd gesture (or ten.)

The actor may tell the team what level of difficulty "X" the phrase is but no other oral communication is allowed. Once the sandtimer is flipped, the acting and guessing commences.
